notesStmt.note: Lacunae after folios 1, 9, 13, 14, 16, 17, 18, 19, 25, 26, 34, 35, 36, 42, 43, 44, 50, 51, 52, 61, 69, 137, 138, 139, 140, 176, 182, 183, 191, 206, 210, 211, 217, 223, 232, 238, 248. Blank leaves inserted to mark lacunae. A number of folios have been more or less mutilated.

Folios 288r-290v have been added later, contain the Hebrew text in Arabic transcription of Judges 20:18-35, 21:5-14. The Hebrew vowel-points and accents are given in red ink. Space fillers in gold. Probably of 10th century. The handwriting is similar to the one in the appendix of George Margoliouth, Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, 4 vols (London: British Museum, 1899-1935; vols I-III repr. 1965); IV, Introduction, Indexes, ed. by Jacob Leveen (London: British Museum, 1977), no. 278..
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The book of Joshua, Judges and Samuel in Arabic characters, with punctuation, accentuation, an Arabic translation and a commentary of Yefet ben ʿEli.

collation.p:
Quires of 10 leaves each, most of them incomplete.
Quires signed with Arabic numerals, only partially preserved.
Several major lacunae in between the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: A Naskhi hand of approximately 11th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Joshua, Judges & Samuel. Hebrew & Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2547.'
